etymologies: modern Latin, named in honor of Dr Alexander Garden (1730–91), Scottish naturalist

definitions: a tree or shrub of the bedstraw family, with large fragrant white or yellow flowers. Native to warm climates, it is widely cultivated.

notes.text: Genus Gardenia, family Rubiaceae: several species, in particular the Cape jasmine

shortDefinitions: tree or shrub of warm climates, with large, fragrant white or yellow flowers
